page.description: There are situations where you will want to hide a column or row. This will be true if you are placing the field in a different column or row using a Freeform template. A freeform layout allows to insert any HTML code plus any combination of fields on the grid into a grid column.

section.description: For example, although your database had firstname and lastname fields, a freeform layout could display a single name field that combined these two values. In almost all cases you will want to define the column or row heading. If you want to control access to this field, you may set a minimum security level requirement (V7). A users with a too low security level will not be able to see the column. The column's cell in-line style field defines additional HTML formatting that you want to apply to the cell of the grid. If you wanted to change the border or background of the cell, this is where you would do it. The can sort property enables and disables the ability to click on the column heading and sort the current page based on the values in the selected column.

section.title: Hide column
section.description: Hides the column or row that would contain this field. You might choose to hide the field if it was displayed in a free-form layout.

section.title: Column heading
section.description: The label that identifies the column o row.

section.title: Column in-line style
section.description: Specifies style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click to define the In-line style. Refer to the Style Editor for details.

section.title: Heading prefix, Label prefix
section.description: Specify HTML text or the path to and name of an image to be displayed to the left of the row or above the column heading.

section.title: Row label position
section.description: The position of the label in relationship to the control. The options are:"Left", "Right", "Above", "Below"

section.title: Can sort
section.description: Specifies whether the grid will be sorted when the user clicks on the column or row heading.

section.title: Sort field
section.description: Specify the field(s) to sort on when user clicks on the column or row title. Put commas between field names.

section.title: Freeform layout
section.description: Specify if this column or row should display just this field, or allow a free-form layout. The options are: "Freeform"

section.title: Freeform template
section.description: Click [...] to display the Freeform Column Layoutdialog box to define the fields and formats to display in this grid cell.

section.title: Cell in-line style
section.description: Specifies style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click [...] to define the In-line style. Refer to the Style Editor for details.

section.title: Security level
section.description: If the user is logged in with a security level that is lower than the security level you specify here, the column or row will be hidden. Set the security level to 0 to always show this column or row.

section.title: Style label if error
section.description: Specify if the label should be styled if a validation error occurs (V6 only).

section.title: Label in-line error style
section.description: Specifies style attributes that override the settings inherited from the style sheet. Click to define the In-line style. Refer to the Style Editor for details (V6 only).

section.title: Break Type
section.description: Forces a new row either before or after a control. The options are: "None", "Break before", "Break after", "Break before and after"

section.title: Column Span
section.description: The number of columns to group together.

section.title: Dynamic Column and Row Grid Headings
section.description: If you would like to be able to dynamically change the title of a grid column or row, the solution to creating conditional headings in grid components is to define a variable that contains the column or row heading that you want to display. Change "component_name" to the name of your component. Change "[1]" to reflect the index number of the column or row you wish to modify. Add additional Xbasic code to set the value of var1.
section.example: with tmpl_1 componentName = "component_name" with field_info[1] .Column.Heading = var1 end with end with
